ğŸ’° **SIP (Systematic Investment Plan)**

Invest a fixed amount regularly (monthly/quarterly/weekly).

**Benefits:**
â€¢ Start with just â‚¹500
â€¢ Rupee Cost Averaging
â€¢ Power of compounding
â€¢ Disciplined investing
â€¢ Flexible (pause/stop anytime)

**How it works:**
Auto-debit from your bank on chosen date each month.

**Example:**
â‚¹5,000/month in equity fund
10 years @ 12% = â‚¹11.6L
Your investment: â‚¹6L

ğŸ’¡ **Best strategy:** Start small, increase annually!

ğŸ“Š **NAV (Net Asset Value)**

Per-unit price of a mutual fund scheme.

**Formula:**
NAV = (Total Assets - Total Liabilities) / Total Units

**Example:**
Fund with â‚¹100 cr assets, â‚¹5 cr liabilities, 10 cr units
NAV = (100-5)/10 = â‚¹9.50

**Key Facts:**
â€¢ Updated daily after market close
â€¢ Your investment value = Units Ã— NAV
â€¢ Higher NAV â‰  Expensive fund
â€¢ Focus on returns, not NAV value

ğŸ’¡ Don't choose funds by NAV - a â‚¹500 NAV fund can give better returns than â‚¹10 NAV fund!

ğŸ’° **Expense Ratio**

Annual fee for managing your mutual fund (as % of AUM).

**Includes:**
â€¢ Fund manager fees
â€¢ Administrative costs
â€¢ Marketing expenses
â€¢ Transaction costs

**Impact:**
Fund A: 12% return, 1% expense = **11% to you**
Fund B: 12% return, 2% expense = **10% to you**

**SEBI Limits:**
â€¢ Equity: Max 2.25%
â€¢ Debt: Max 2%
â€¢ Index: Usually 0.1-0.5%

ğŸ’¡ Lower expense ratio = More money in your pocket!

ğŸšª **Exit Load**

Fee charged when redeeming units before specified period.

**Typical Structure:**
â€¢ **Equity:** 1% if within 1 year
â€¢ **Debt:** 0.25-1% if within 3-6 months
â€¢ **ELSS:** 3-year lock-in (can't exit)

**Example:**
Redeem â‚¹1,00,000 within 1 year
Exit load: 1%
You get: â‚¹99,000

**Purpose:**
â€¢ Discourages short-term trading
â€¢ Protects long-term investors
